title: I f-ing hate this community.
body:
At EIGHT SECONDS INTO THE GAME, our vayne types in all chat "gg" and then tells our team she forgot to put the right runes and masteries. So at 3 minutes she gives first blood, blames it on the runes and masteries and then says "afk". Then goes to my top lane and proceeds to feed three free kills, while TYPING IN ALL CHAT "I have wrong runes and masteries" "it's gg" "so I'm giving free kills to you". And then quits the game at the 6:39 mark.

F that person, and f the people like that in this community that ruin this game.



EDIT: OAIDNLFH;aksfhjak;'gkfjasi[fu gas;kfgs;kBF;ADKBFs;kafg adk'bfs;ka SIU[FG - THE VAYNE RECONNECTED AT 18 MINUTES AND VOTED NO ON THE SURRENDER AND WE HAVE A FUCKING TRYHARD BLITZ SUPPORT WITH 13 DEATHS WHO TYPED NEVER SURRENDER AND THIS FUCKING GAME IS STILL BEING PLAYED OJMSAFOKHALKFHALFKHAS;FJGHALK;FGJHA;KDFGBAD;KFGJ

Edit X2: The game mercifully ended at the 24 minute mark. The player in question, on their profile, has 10 straight defeats, with a KDA of 23:111 in those matches. It's good to know that players like this continue to persist in the game.

replies.body: Large community means there are going to be asshats like that. Doesn't mean we're all like that though, in fact I beleive there are just as many awesome people here. They're just not as in-your-face about it.
You're 100% correct. I love those (seemingly) rare times when I get a cooperative or miraculously friendly team. It's just the asshats seem to loom larger out there.

It's also a matter of human tendency. We always remember the negative *so* much more than the positive.

Here's a fun thing to try: For the next 20 or so games you play write down your experience between "good", "uneventful" or "bad" as far as peer behavior. You may be surprised at the results at the end.
Challenge accepted. :) I'll let you know the results.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir ArmaMalum,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=4pEguEA2,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2014-12-30T19:03:20.003+0000)
>
> It's also a matter of human tendency. We always remember the negative *so* much more than the positive.
> 
> Here's a fun thing to try: For the next 20 or so games you play write down your experience between "good", "uneventful" or "bad" as far as peer behavior. You may be surprised at the results at the end.

I have and I'm not surprised. In my last 20 games (even the wins) I have had a one case of nice in a win, lots of cases of negative even in wins (it's gg, it's gg, etc even in games we easily won), and the uneventful turned into even angry ranting usually come the lobbies and the sudden "report x" just because they lost a game and someone needs to take the blame in their opinion.

I think in reality if you were to do the same as you suggested you might actually be the one getting the surprise sadly, which is depressing and I hope I'm wrong but from my own experiences I'm not.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir ArmaMalum,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=4pEguEA2,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2014-12-30T19:03:20.003+0000)
>
> It's also a matter of human tendency. We always remember the negative *so* much more than the positive.
> 
> Here's a fun thing to try: For the next 20 or so games you play write down your experience between "good", "uneventful" or "bad" as far as peer behavior. You may be surprised at the results at the end.

1000x over this

It's easy to remember negative experiences and forget the positive ones.  I'm not very invested in the games I play, and I play a lot with good friends.  Instances like the one you described can suck, but sometimes it's better to just laugh it off.  I still remember some really bad experiences I had in the past that ended up just being hilarious memories for me because of the way I treated it. 

Forever I will remember the Zed I played with who didn't understand the ult mechanic.  When I told him he had to do damage after he marked someone he said "It's a game. Anything can happen."  Since that day "It's ____.  **Anything** can happen." has become one of my favorite inside jokes with my friends who experienced that moment.  Make something positive out of the negative (when you can) and do your best to enjoy the good moments.  It'll make you less stressed in general!
I agree. It is in human nature to remember bad things more than good things. So the good people fade into the back ground in a lot of people's memory.

Ironically research suggests the opposite.

Do you not recall how many old people remember the "Good old times"?

It's called "[Negativity Bias](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Negativity_bias)." And it's a real thing, supported by plenty of research.

It may not explain everything about toxicity and our game experiences, but it certainly plays a significant part.

That's true. Your mood is far worsened by negative experiences. That still doesn't change the fact that you recall positive notions in greater amount. 

Anothing thing thats supported by research but I'm too lazy to search for a cite.

Except that: "The negativity bias has been investigated within many different domains, including the formation of impressions and general evaluations; **attention, learning, and memory**; and decision-making and risk considerations."

Emphasis mine. Here's some more:

"Intentional memory is also impacted by the stimuliâ€™s negative or positive quality. When studying both positive and negative behaviors, participants tend to recall more negative behaviors during a later memory test than they do positive behaviors, even after controlling for serial position effects. There is also evidence that people exhibit better recognition memory and source memory for negative information."

There's even citations for that quote I could add. Or, how about this, for relevance:

"People also tend to underestimate how frequently they experience positive affect, in that they more often forget the positively emotional experiences than they forget negatively emotional experiences."

We can debate the value of Negativity Bias in viewing toxicity. We can consider its relevance to any particular approach to toxicity. But let's not argue about the very basis of it. Far cleverer people than we have gone above and beyond to demonstrate it and understand it.

> [{quoted}](name=Sir ArmaMalum,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=4pEguEA2,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2014-12-30T18:31:06.205+0000)
>
> Large community means there are going to be asshats like that. Doesn't mean we're all like that though, in fact I beleive there are just as many awesome people here. They're just not as in-your-face about it.

The "small" group of trolls seem to even turn normal community members into raging drooling lunatics sometimes.

I've had games go from fine, to someone gives first blood and GG with most of our team trying to placate them saying it's alright we got this to 20 minutes in half the team is arguing, jungler is trolling, adc is intentionally feeding, and mid just afks.

This isn't an exact example so much as an exaggeration, but half the time it doesn't take much for 5 strangers (especially when most of this community is teenagers or people in their early 20s, both rather immature, not saying anything actually bad about them, just a fact of life) to have a few things go wrong and just start arguing.

I've always enjoyed ranked but despise it so much at the same time. You have 5 strangers who never have and may never again talk to one another put on a team with one goal, assuming they aren't arguing when the game starts, they have to be on the same wavelength to an extent, then they are competitive trying to win and unlike normals Riot tosses all sorts of notices and updates at you when you do well or badly. 

So you win, Congrats, nice green +lp and a shiny new Gold, and these borders and skins and ward skins, etc, everyone is happy. The opposite is the problem, some things go bad in the game, someone goes afk, someone rages, trolls etc, that unhappy red -lp pops up, the pop up message over your screen telling you that you were demoted or lost a series shows up, you get to see you made fun of rank (especially if you are in bronze which is like having aids in this community for some reason), you don't get the cool borders, or the cool skins, etc.  It quickly goes from happy game to competitive mess because Riot is good at rewarding but unfortunately the entire way the ranked system is laid out breeds negative all over the place.

Don't forget all the in game things they toss in your face like making sure you should be excited about that triple kill, but tossing it in your face just as big when the enemy does it, even giving that sad "aced" when you all die. Throwing the defeat at you and making you have to click continue. Again, this community is filled with a large group of immature ages so it isn't hard to see (even though it pisses me off) why games can turn into shout fests rather quickly.

thats funny because league is actually like more than 50% hostile BM now a days.
Its a f2p Game.

Theres rarely a game I end up saying a was a good game for both sides anymore.
Its a real rarity.
I might end up finding a gem of a player who does really well despite being on the shit team.
But, yet again, very rare.

Theres nothing worse than meeting someone (and theres alot of these)
that mains one of the 5-10 broken FOTM champs because of its kit, not because they're actually good at the game mechnically (this includes warding... good decision making... Csing...positioning...)
Because the FOTM champ makes up for poor mechanics with overloaded kit...sigh

Even if i accidentally take the wrong masteries or runes I never have this attitude I always still try my best to not feed. I might not do the best that I should be doing without them, but I DO try my hardest.

And that's all you need to do. Honestly I understand runes and masteries make a big impact, but they will not make or break a game (for most mmr/most games). You can make up for them with solid mechanics or playing intelligently.

one day i was playing khazix b4 preseason 5 w/ad masteries and cleared well
the next day ia ccidentally took ap masteries and i died to my wolves.
You should probably look at your hp bar.

This same sort of mistake once had me running AP runes/masteries on Varus.  Got distracted by my roommate during champion select, and didn't realise I had my last game's stuff still set up.  I'm Silver for a reason...  >_>  

We had a Zed mid and Panth top so seemed good when it came to AD.  Before buying anything, I told my team what happened, and asked if I could just test going AP this game.  The Zed was a bit wary, but the Panth laughed it off and said to go for it.  My support was less than enthused, but eventually just said that if I fed would just go support mid or top.  Early game was rough, but when I started to get into the habit of activating W for max damage, things got shredded.  

I'm really glad that I had a supportive team that game, otherwise I'd not have learned how fun AP Varus is.  Had they said to just go AD, I'd still have done well (I think), but thanks to them I had a lot of fun doing something unconventional.
I f-ing hate people that say it's a bad community because of a few trolls.  Community would indicate the majority are negative vs. a few.
Your attitude would imply that you belong in the very category you are commenting lives in the minority. Check. Mate.
so is ur's Check. Mate.
....the title of my thread blatantly states the position you accuse me of being in. You found a way to put your own king in check. That's not allowed in chess, but somehow you found a way.

tbh he put his and yours in check in the same move, your post does just read like someone bitching about bad/asshole players, which you are doing, not trying to be an ass, just stating the overall state of things.

No worries I get what you're saying. But you really think someone saying gg at 8 seconds and afking at 6 minutes is the same kind of player as someone who says that people who do that ruin the gaming experience? I just feel like there's kind of a difference.

You know what the problem with this community is?  People too often side with trolls.  The whole "no naming and shaming" thing, then if you are in game and respond to a troll your team and the enemy team will take their side somehow.  

If all players in the game swiftly denounced the troll, instead of being silent and compliant to them, then this would change.  A majority of people refuse to take a side when it's clear what is happening.  Your silence is compliance, and if you were really a "good community" these people wouldn't feel so welcome here.
I freaking agree with this 100%.

I don't understand this. I played all the way up to my placement and some games in ranked without runes, still play some roles without proper roles, and I don't understand the bloody obsession with runes. they're nice but seriously, they aren't life and death.

Welcome to a f2p community.
Sad but true.

Aeon of strife and the original Dota/Chaos heros wasn't the perfect moba.
But they were originals and i';d say 90% of my played games were satisfyingly fun and exciting with the only trolling being  auto canceling someone to death when they know they're dead (you can hear the auto attack sound in league when you spam click+s...thats basicially what we did.. yeah its BM but it was funny and people usually were all good sports about BM back then)
Theres a difference between hostile BM and just being a jackass.
Anyone can be a jackass.
Only a hostile loser can be hostile BM.
Feeding/Afking/Negative attitude is hostile BM.
Promotes negativity ruins gameplay.. etc etc.. you name it...

In a game like aeon of strife(its a modded map/UMS for broodwar) for broodwar you really only had veteran map makers playing something like Aeon of Strife.
yeah it was popular but it was still an unpopular way to play broodwar compared to the regular RTS and thats even considering broodwars popularlity.
It wasn't even that popular of an RTS when you looked at the playerbase of gamers.
Most people played single player games or avoided PVP games back then (mid-late 90's)


I'd say its the overall poor parenting that seems to be common now a days.
People aren't raised with respect and manners anymore.
If anyone even said 1/10th of the shit you see in video games now a days my mother would've backhanded you back into your mothers womb so you could come out a better child next time maybe and then back handed your mother for raising you like a complete failure to society.

It's absolutely unacceptable the kind of talk people are using now a days.
I've never once used racist slanders, rape jokes, disease jokes(this is cancer lelelel...that kind of thing).
I mean the worse you'll see me talk about is my brain hurting from what just happened.
But thats about as far as I go honestly.

Theres people that just will say anything that pops into their head and its really upsetting and makes us more restrained gamers look really poorly despite us being the actual majority of gamers.


Nice people used to be the majority.
And now that we're getting into a spoiled generation of children it's becoming the miniority.
I hope the world changes for better and doesn't go down such a dark path.
It upsets me to always hear from a friend irl how theres so many toxic players in X game.
It wasn't this way 10+ years ago.
Good God reading your post was like an out of body experience. I can see myself writing literally every word you said.

=]
I call em like I see em.

This and This. So much This and This. I remember when I would play online games before and killing someone was a "good job, nice shot" etc. Now it is "lucky shot noob, with your noob gun, get cancer noob" etc etc. (I've actually had someone say that to me recently, funny enough as their voice was cracking)

ya ever sense the lcs got to become what it is today its gone down hill...........trolls toxic ppl this game was fun at a time before I started to rank 2 yrs ago..........nice ppl back then. I go on my smurf who is 10 n omfg soooo many ppl flame down there like they are 30s n should kno how to play lmfao just sad

WHAT THE F***. I DON"T EVEN USE RUNES OR MASTERIES BECAUSE I'M NOT LVL 30 AND IT DOESN'T AFFECT ANYTHING.

Edit:  Not
I suggest you at least get masteries, they're free.
I don't use masteries, becuase I don't have access to them all. I'll edit my mastery pages once I have all 30.

You can always change masteries and add pages whenever you want.  Unlike runes, masteries are free and can always be modified at no cost (except a little time) to you.  

It really is in a player's best interests to start using masteries as soon as possible.  Runes are something I can understand putting off until you can get Tier 3 ones, but masteries are absolutely necessary.  You'll notice an immediate difference, whether you're a tank with a bunch of points in the defense tree, a support with things that help give additional gold, or a carry that is doing increased damage.  There really is no reason not to use masteries.
Thanks for this information. I will put it to use as soon as possible.
I do that on my smurf lol its no point really sure its a lil harder to cs then im use to but I figure it out

This is why the 'report' feature is complete BS.  Most of the ways to grief players are not in the list, nor mentioned in the summoners code.  Pissed off at the junlger for not ganking?  Run around in his jungle stealing his buffs while letting your lane fall.  Want to troll the mid?  Just double up in his lane pushing the minion wave, if he changes lanes follow.  What's funny is in hose cases BOTH players will most likely get reported.  This community is a toxic cesspool, riot knows it and does nothing because its more profitable to leave it that way then to actually try to fix it.

I'd hate to live near this guy.

"Oh my, I put on the wrong underpants before I came to the movies. Better murder everyone in the theater and then kill myself because there's no possible way the rest of my life will ever go right."
If it wasn't for those type of people I wouldn't be toxic but because there  is i'm toxic for calling a dumbass a dumbass and I get punished while the troll gets away with it.
Sadly I agree with you, I tend to be the same way unfortunately.
And after reading this whole thing, the first word that comes to my mind is "yep."

The community really isn't that bad. It's just a small portion of players that make it a pain. Think about this, if 5% of the community is an asshat FIVE PERCENT (a really tiny portion of an otherwise awesome playerbase) that means your probably going to have at least one toxic person once every two games. This means league's player base is actually mostly a good, friendly player base but there is a few grumpy a-holes that ruin it. 
TL;DR PLEASE REPORT THESE PEOPLE.

I'd say the number is closed to ten percent.  But the problem is even if the toxic is in the minority they still can ruin the majority of the games. With 5% rate of asshats that means one team or the other is gonna have an asshats in 50% of games. At 10% ratio of asshast you get atleast one in every game on a team effectively ruining 100% of games. In both cases this is unacceptable.
Well we F-Ing LOVE you! ^_~
I feel the

I hate that. I had a Team Builder a little while back where our top-lane Rengar ran to turret, fed First Blood before jungle spawned, and immediately afk'd. Never came back.

Have to say, though, we played like beasts that game. Kept overall KDA even for most of the game, kept more pressure for most of the game, and actually had better overall damage. Just couldn't quite overcome that presence deficit.

I have had the rare, so very rare, successful 4v5 game but it requires a large number of factors going your way. Unfortunately, my team proceeded to rage and kind of just ran into the bayonets type of play. Thankfully even with the troll Vayne coming back the game ended at 24 minutes. But that was 18 minutes of ridiculousness.
It's not a game anymore, jackass. These are real people whos lives you have to deal with.
